A better answer might have been that the devs have already said they wont do that, because in their eyes the point of the game is to play it, rather than have your computer play it for you (which actually isn't a lsight against people who use mechjeb, even though I just did a fantastic job of making it sound like one). I imagine at some point the guidance system (or whatever they called it) that was originally slated for... .15 I think, will once again be up for development, which will allow you to play out a flight in advance, and give you indicators in game to guide you (but you still do all the flying). They will leave the autopilot in the hands of the mod community.

At least that is my understanding.

Aside from the planets, I am looking forward to the new indicators for stuff like drag and thrust and CoG.

Also thinking perhaps some sort of camera should be built into the game (unless we get a ground radar to shows distance and ideally inclination), because if we want to fly start to end without ever leaving the cockpit, landing is going to be pretty much impossible without using an autopilot that does know where the ground is. Or we are going to have to get more creative in our landers so that the windows face down (which would actually be a fantastic way to land).
